title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Suwon
text:
The Diocese of Suwon (<a href="Latin">Lat.</a>: "Dioecesis Suvonensis") is a <a href="particular%20church">particular church</a> of the <a href="Latin%20Rite">Latin Rite</a> of the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Church">Catholic Church</a>. The <a href="cathedra">seat</a> of the Bishop of Suwon is at <a href="Jeongjadong%20Cathedral">Jeongjadong Cathedral</a> in <a href="Suwon">Suwon</a>, <a href="Gyeonggi-do">Gyeonggi-do</a>, <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a>.
<a href="Pope%20Paul%20VI">Pope Paul VI</a> created the <a href="episcopal%20see">episcopal see</a> on October 7, 1963. The territory had previously been part of the <a href="Archdiocese%20of%20Seoul">Archdiocese of Seoul</a>, to which Suwon is <a href="suffragan">suffragan</a>.
